source_note: State baseline derived from Utah DEQ rules and statutes; local rules may vary.

organics.guidance: Recycling or composting facilities must submit operations plans and may be regulated under solid waste rules. :contentReference[oaicite:0]{index=0}
organics.bin: Green/organics cart or facility bin (if available via local program).
organics.notes: No statewide requirement for residential organics collection.

paper_cardboard.guidance: Recycle clean, dry paper, cardboard, and cartons via curbside or drop-off programs. :contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}
paper_cardboard.bin: Blue recycling bin or mixed paper bin.
paper_cardboard.notes: Exclude soiled paper and waxed or greasy containers.

glass_containers.guidance: Recycle glass bottles and jars (rinse before dropping in).
glass_containers.bin: Mixed recycling bin or separate glass bin if local program supports it.
glass_containers.notes: Broken glass or non-container glass often not accepted. :contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2}
provenance: Local municipal recycling guidelines (e.g. Saratoga Springs)

metal_containers.guidance: Recycle aluminum and steel cans (empty and rinsed).
metal_containers.notes: Labels are okay; no scrap metal in curbside bins.
provenance: Local recycle programs (e.g. Salt Lake City accepted materials) :contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}

plastics.guidance: Recycle rigid plastic containers (#1, #2, #4, #5) depending on local acceptance. :contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4}
plastics.notes: Plastic bags, film, foam, and certain “other” plastics often not accepted. :contentReference[oaicite:5]{index=5}

beverage_containers_crv.guidance: Utah does **not** have a state beverage container refund (CRV) program.
beverage_containers_crv.bin: Include in regular recycling where accepted.
beverage_containers_crv.notes: No state deposit/refund requirement for containers.
provenance: Utah e-waste/electronics law summaries (state policy overviews)

household_batteries.guidance: Manage batteries under universal waste rules; rechargeable batteries should be recycled. :contentReference[oaicite:6]{index=6}
household_batteries.bin: Drop-off at battery or hazardous waste collection sites.
household_batteries.notes: Do not place in trash or regular recycling bins due to fire risk.
provenance: Utah Universal Waste / Hazardous Waste Rules

e_waste.guidance: Under Utah’s Disposal of Electronic Waste Act, manufacturers must offer programs for collecting consumer electronics. :contentReference[oaicite:7]{index=7}
e_waste.bin: Drop off at e-waste collection sites or mail-back programs where applicable.
e_waste.notes: The law does not mandate recycling by households; reporting and education are required. :contentReference[oaicite:8]{index=8}
provenance: Utah Disposal of Electronic Waste Act (SB 184)

plastic_bags_and_film.guidance: Plastic bags and film are generally *not* accepted in curbside recycling.
plastic_bags_and_film.bin: Return to store drop-off bins (grocery or retail) if available.
plastic_bags_and_film.notes: They clog sorting machinery and contaminate recycling. :contentReference[oaicite:9]{index=9}

bulky_items.guidance: Bulky items (furniture, appliances, mattresses) need special pickup or drop-off at local transfer facilities.
bulky_items.notes: Fees or restrictions may apply depending on city/county policy.
provenance: Local municipal waste programs, Utah DEQ solid waste rules
